      • setSoftLimits

        public void setSoftLimits(double[] lowerLimits,
                          double[] upperLimits)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sets the upper and lower limits of the stage. Each passed array must have a length of 6. The arrays must be passed in the form {X,Y,Z,Rx,Ry,Rz}.
        Parameters:
        lowerLimits -
        upperLimits -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • isInitialized

        public boolean isInitialized()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Used to test if any of the stage's axis have been homed. Returns true if stage has been homed and zeroed since last power up.

      • isReady

                throws java.io.IOException

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • moveStageAbsolute

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> moveStageAbsolute(double[] position,
                                                                        boolean matchVel)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Moves the stage to the absolute position from the given position parameter in the form {X,Y,Z,Rx,Ry,Rz}. The boolean is used to enable/disable a synchronized move. The synchronized move will calculate the distance of the move from the current position and modify the velocity and acceleration of each axis in order to reach their destinations at the same time.

        Returns a Future for blocking and getting motion status.

        Parameters:
        position -
        matchVel -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • moveStageSequence

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> moveStageSequence(double[][] positions,
                                                                        boolean matchVel)
                                                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Allows user to send a large 2-dimensional array that the stage will move to in the order in which the array is indexed.

        The array must have 6 columns otherwise an IOException will occur.

        Parameters:
        positions -
        matchVel -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • homeStage

        public java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Integer> homeStage()
                                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Calls the home procedure sequence.

        Returns a Future for blocking and getting motion status.

        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • lock

        public void lock()
        Locks the axis from getting any other motion commands until the axis is then unlocked.
        This is used in the case where the user wants to complete uninterrupted complex motions without another process/command from interrupting. An example of this would be a homing procedure.

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
        Unlocks the axis from a previous lock.

      • trylock

        public boolean trylock()
        Tries to see if the axis is locked. If it's already locked, it will return false. If unlocked, the axis will become locked and will return true.
        Returns:

      • isLocked

        public boolean isLocked()
        Test for a previously stated lock.
        Returns:
        true for the axis being locked.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Disconnects axis from the communication Channel. Eg. Socket
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getErrors

        public java.lang.String getErrors()
                           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Returns a string containing all of the errors on every axis. This also clears the errors.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
